lexUnit.name: undermine.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: damage or weaken, especially gradually or insidiously.

sentence.text: A programme of acquisitions which results in repeated dilution would seriously undermine Anglo-Welsh 's ability to diversify , whichever direction they eventually wished to go .
The committee says the absence of disciplinary action had undermined the future effectiveness of the bank .
The Times said The Independent 's move was ` absurd " and undermined by its own declared circulation figures since the price cut .
The three parties had disagreed on major issues and the coalition had been undermined by national discontent over recent austerity measures .
Further , the principle of freely swapping weather data could be undermined by a firm setting out to market the information at the highest price .
This insurrection was eventually undermined by the government .
The marriage was soon undermined by Price 's homosexuality and alcoholism .
Business confidence was undermined in 1990 by a series of spectacular corporate failures .
Scientific enterprise is undermined by the extreme forms of relativism .
The Red Cross claims that every misuse of the symbol undermines its authority and endangers its members operating in difficult conditions .
But as far as the security services are concerned , the Kremlin is still plotting to undermine world capitalism and J. Edgar Hoover is still holed up in the FBI powder room .
He rejects as mistaken the notion that the study of other religions might undermine or weaken a believer 's faith in his own religion .
Subject specialization and formal teaching would be undermined .
Closer inspection tends to undermine this position , which is obviously a comfortable one for the well paid .
Secondly , asking relatives for help can undermine the moral base on which relations with kin are built .
He was trying to undermine her self-confidence , make her believe she could n't stand up to the exigencies of canal life .

The value of this announcement as a " confidence-building " measure is severely undermined by statements issued during Baker 's visit by hardline Housing Minister Ariel Sharon promising increased Jewish settlement in the occupied territories .
Too often , unnecessary organisational problems undermine the process .
The general election , due by Jan. 19 , 1992 , had been called on Oct. 7 , after Flemish and Walloon differences had undermined the coalition on two occasions .
She undermined his private notion of himself .
The work of regulatory agencies was also undermined by budget cuts and a concerted unwillingness to enforce existing regulations .
